User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10

If you set up Sync successfully, but Firefox isn't cleanly closed (e.g. you power off the computer), Firefox forgets that Sync was already setup and you must do it again.

The original setup was successful because remote info was copied (and is still there when starting Firefox again).

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add computer to sync account
2. Forcibly quit Firefox (hard reboot, SIGTERM, etc.)
3. Start Firefox again
Actual Results:  
Sync configuration forgotten.

Expected Results:  
Sync configuration remembered.
comments.creator: austin.donisan@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Still happens even after creating a fresh Sync account with a clean profile.

I'm not sure if I was clear above, this bug only appears if Firefox crashes during the session in which you set up Sync. If you setup Sync, close Firefox, open Firefox, force quit Firefox there's no bug. Only if you setup Sync and then force quit Firefox (without cleanly closing it in between) does the configuration get lost. This situation is pretty rare, but it's still definitely a bug.
